definition: to speak/to say/to explain/to scold/to tell off/a theory (typically the last character in a compound, as in 日心說|日心说 heliocentric theory)
fitting snugly/appropriate/suitable/variant of 貼|贴[tie1]/to paste/to obey
official communication (between gov. offices of equal rank)/report delivered by the head of gov. on affairs of state
the Qing dynasty equivalent of the Foreign Office
to lay out (an argument) item by item/memorandum to a superior
imperial edict/see also 聖諭|圣谕[sheng4 yu4]
Ministry of Foreign Affairs in Qing Dynasty
credentials (of a diplomat)/documents exchanged between nations/national or dynastic history book
to do as one thinks fit/to handle by taking circumstances into consideration
memorial to the emperor (folded in accordion form)
to hold a (business) meeting/to start negotiations
